intro: Paracaryum anchusoides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom from spring to autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
